subtitle: An all-in-one meal - when you fancy something special.

method.text: Preheat oven to 200°C. Lightly grease a baking tray.
Cook the sweet potato in boiling salted water until soft. Drain. Mash until smooth. Add the egg yolk and allow to cool.

Divide into equal portions. Form each portion into a cake shape. Coat each cake in flour, the beaten egg, and finally, breadcrumbs. Re-shape and deep fry for about 4 min until golden and crispy. Keep hot.

Heat the olive oil in a frying pan. Add the the courgette, aubergine and skinned tomato and the chilli pepper and toss together lightly for 1-2 min until softened. Remove from heat and leave the pan and its contents to cool.

Place a 7. 5 cm cutter onto the baking tray. Layer the courgette, aubergine and tomato alternately into the cutter until it is full. Remove and repeat for each individual vegetable gateau. Bake for 8-10 min.
While the vegetables are cooking, pour the red wine in a frying pan and bring to the boil. Add the garlic, bay leaf, rosemary, onion and carrot and simmer for 5 min.
Add the loins of lamb and simmer for 5 min on each side. The lamb should now be pink and the wine reduced to almost nothing.
Add the lamb stock and bring to the boil, stirring. Remove from heat and pass through a fine sieve into a sauce boat.
Cut the loins into two and dress in the centre of each serving plate with the sweet potato galette and the vegetable gateau. Surround with the red wine sauce and serve.

title: Loin of lamb with sweet potato and spiced vegetables
